Attributes.title: Common Attributes of the link Tag

Attrs.desc: Specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked resource.

values.desc: Links to an external CSS file.
Links to a favicon or icon.
Preloads certain resources to improve page load speed.
Provides alternate versions of the document (e.g., a different language or format).
Links to a web app manifest.

Attrs.desc: Specifies the URL of the linked resource.
Specifies the MIME type of the linked resource, typically used with stylesheets as text/css.
Specifies the media type or media query for which the linked resource is optimized.
Specifies the size of the icons for rel="icon"
Specifies how the linked resource should be handled regarding cross-origin requests.

values.desc: No credentials (cookies, HTTP authentication, and client-side SSL certificates) will be sent.
Credentials will be sent with the request.

Attrs.desc: Used with rel="preload" to specify the type of content being loaded.
Provides a security feature by allowing you to specify a cryptographic hash of the resource to ensure it hasn’t been tampered with.

Uses.title: Common Uses of the link Tag

uses.title: Linking to Stylesheets
uses.desc: The most common use of the `link` tag is to link to an external CSS file.

uses.title: Linking to Icons
uses.desc: The link tag is used to link to favicons and other icons that browsers display in tabs or bookmarks.

uses.title: Preloading Resources
uses.desc: Preloading allows you to load resources early in the page’s lifecycle, improving performance.

uses.title: Alternate Versions of a Document
uses.desc: Provides links to alternate versions of the page, like different languages.

uses.title: Manifest File
uses.desc: Links to a web app manifest, which provides metadata about the web application.
